message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the mass and biopsy result suggests neuroblastoma, which is commonly associated with MYCN oncogene amplification. The other options are not commonly associated with neuroblastoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the presence of a mass in the left adrenal gland suggest neuroblastoma, which is commonly associated with amplification of the MYCN oncogene. KRAS is commonly involved in colorectal and lung cancer, ALK in lung cancer, and RET in medullary thyroid cancer.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest he has neuroblastoma, which is a type of childhood cancer that starts in early nerve cells. Among the options, MYCN is most commonly associated with neuroblastoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and the biopsy results suggest neuroblastoma. MYCN amplification is the most commonly associated oncogene with neuroblastoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, abnormal eye movements, and an adrenal mass suggest neuroblastoma. Among the oncogenes listed, MYCN is most commonly associated with neuroblastoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the patient’s symptoms and the biopsy result suggest a diagnosis of neuroblastoma with MYCN oncogene amplification. MYCN amplification is seen in approximately 25% of neuroblastoma cases and is associated with a poorer prognosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical examination suggest neuroblastoma, and among the options, only MYCN gene amplification is commonly associated with neuroblastoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the biopsy results suggest neuroblastoma, which is commonly associated with MYCN oncogene amplification. KRAS oncogene is commonly associated with various tumors, but not neuroblastoma. ALK and RET oncogenes are also observed in neuroblastoma, but not as commonly as MYCN.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, laboratory results, and biopsy all suggest a diagnosis of neuroblastoma. Among the options, MYCN is the most commonly associated oncogene with neuroblastoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and findings suggest that the patient has neuroblastoma, with the presence of a mass in the left adrenal gland and elevated VMA levels. MYCN amplification is the most common oncogene associated with neuroblastoma, with up to 25% of cases showing this abnormality.
